ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: I wish the course was organized better on canvas and in person. It didnt feel very useful since most of the time we did presentations. I wish we had better notice about shows especially about final install. I think if seniors started planning with AL and the install a week or two before we did this year the projects would have been more complete
How to collaboratively critique and provide feedback for each others work as well as be exposed to life after graduation in terms of career path

This class is a weekly meeting of all the art (and computing and the arts) majors, similar to Senior Project I. We talk about our art and our progress on our projects; it's an opportunity to visit your classmates' studios and see their processes.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: There were a lot of students so classes could be inconsistent but there was always constant feedback which was helpful for everyone

Strengths: I enjoyed seeing my classmates' work; we had some visiting speakers towards the end of the semester who were great

Weaknesses: because performance in this class period isn't factored into your senior project grade, a lot of people straight up didn't come to class much of the time. Having a smaller group is nice sometimes, but mostly it was a little disappointing and low-energy.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: If youre an art major you have to take it
Well, yes, in that I'd recommend the art major. This class is required for 2nd-semester senior art majors.
